column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Do a Speed Paint
#Text=Have you ever wanted to do a speed paint ?
#Text=Have you seen so many and thought " I wish I could do that ! " ?
#Text=Well here you go .
#Text=If you are just here to find a good painting program than go to the Preparing Section .
#Text=Steps
#Text=If you want to do a speed paint you first need to get a painting program .
#Text=Do n't worry its free .

#Text=My favorite ones to use are youidraw and the animal jam art studio.file:///Users/jasmine/Desktop/Screen%20Shot%202016-11-05%20at%202.21.21%20PM.png( thats a picture of youidraw )file:///Users/jasmine/Desktop/Screen%20Shot%202016-11-05%20at%202.21.02%20PM.png(
#Text=thats a picture of the A. J art studio . )
#Text=Once you have chosen a drawing site or app , try to draw something .
#Text=Remember you 're not going to be picasso on your first try .
#Text=Keep on drawing things and using picture references to help you if you 'd like .
#Text=Once you get the hang of drawing test your limits
#Text=try something you have n't done before .
#Text=Also do n't just draw online , try it on paper too .
#Text=Remember to qualify as a speed paint it does n't necessarily have to be on the computer .
#Text=Remember practice makes perfect !
#Text=Once you have been practicing drawing and like how you are doing you 're probably going to want to be able to record it .
#Text=To record your screen on a mac simply hold down Command then hit space .
#Text=This will activate spotlight .
#Text=Once spotlight is open type in quicktimeplayer this will bring up the application ( it comes with the computer so every one has it )
#Text=now this is the confusing part .
#Text=go up to the bar with the apple symbol and the battery percentage and what time it is and what not and click the button that says ' file ' .
#Text=from there you want to click ' new screen recording '
#Text=it will bring up a gray bar on your sceen .
#Text=then just click on the red button on the gray bar and select the area of the screen you would like to record ( or just click the screen to record the whole screen ) .
#Text=Once you are done making the recording you may want to upload it to youtube .
#Text=Most likely your video will be to long to upload .
#Text=To fix this you can go to imovie ( or which ever editor you want to use ) and click the clock button this will bring up a small menu of if you want it to go in reverse slow or fast .
#Text=Click fast and select the speed at which you would like it to play .
#Text=Then click the upload button which is a box with an arrow pointing up .
#Text=Once you have clicked that it will bring up a menu select YouTube ( or where ever you want to upload )
#Text=now add a title and maybe a description .
#Text=also if you would like to add music you can select it from your itunes media or ad it in later in the YouTube editor .
#Text=once you select upload to YouTube
#Text=you will see an empty circle on your screen
#Text=this shows you how much longer it will take to upload the video .
#Text=Once you are done with all that go to your video and watch it !
#Text=here is an example of a finished speed paint I did !
#Text=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cqa9hluBtvA
#Text=Warnings
#Text=DO NOT DOWNLOAD FIRE ALPACA ! ! ! ! !
#Text=I TRIED AND IT GAVE ME MALWARE ! ! ! ! !
#Text=I REPEAT DO NOT DOWNLOAD FIRE ALPACA
#Text=IT GAVE ME MALWARE !
#Text=I do n't know if what I downloaded was really fire alpaca considering i 've seen speed paints with it but it was all in Japaneese so yeah just do n't download it .
